required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesic Efficacy of a Multiport Versus Uniport Flexible Catheter for Labor Epidural Analgesia
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Controlled, Randomized, Blinded, Single-center Study of the Clinical Efficacy and Outcomes of a Multiport Versus Uniport Flexible Catheter for Epidural Analgesia During Labor and Delivery

collaborator.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether multiple ports improve the analgesic efficacy of flexible catheters used for the provision of epidural analgesia during the entire continuum of labor and delivery

detailed_description.textblock:
Multiport catheters, when compared to uniport catheters, have been associated with better analgesic quality during labor epidural analgesia because the presence of more than one port may enhance the distribution of epidural medication
Flexible catheters, when compared to rigid catheters, have been associated with better analgesic quality during labor epidural analgesia because greater flexibility may minimize catheter deviation in the epidural space, facilitate more optimal catheter placement in the epidural space, and result in better distribution of epidural medication
It is unknown whether multiple ports, which promote better distribution of epidural medication, provide added analgesic benefit to flexible catheters, which also facilitate better distribution of epidural medication, when used for the provision of epidural analgesia during labor and delivery

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes following the initiation of labor epidural analgesia
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adequate analgesia at initiation of labor epidural analgesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Inadequate analgesia at initiation of labor epidural analgesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes following the initiation of labor epidural analgesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Catheter replacement at initiation of labor epidural analgesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 45 minutes following the initiation of labor epidural analgesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Adequate analgesia during the first stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of first stage of labor, an expected average of 6 hours and 30 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Determined from patients receiving patient controlled epidural analgesia (PCEA) who do not require clinician interventions

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient controlled epidural analgesia (PCEA) demands during the first stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of first stage of labor, an expected average of 6 hours and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinician interventions during the first stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of first stage of labor, an expected average of 6 hours and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scale (VAS) pain score at the time of clinician interventions during the first stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of first stage of labor, an expected average of 6 hours and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Catheter replacement during the first stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of first stage of labor, an expected average of 6 hours and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Adequate analgesia during the second stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of second stage of labor, an expected average of 1 hour and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Inadequate analgesia during the second stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of second stage of labor, an expected average of 1 hour and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Inadequate analgesia that failed epidural supplementation during the second stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of second stage of labor, an expected average of 1 hour and 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Anesthetic success rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes following the initiation of epidural anesthesia for cesarean delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of adequate anesthesia at initiation of epidural anesthesia for cesarean delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Inadequate anesthesia at initiation of epidural anesthesia for cesarean delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes following the initiation of epidural anesthesia for cesarean delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Supplementation for breakthrough pain during maintenance of epidural anesthesia for cesarean delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of cesarean delivery, an expected average of 50 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Difficult catheter insertion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter placement, an expected average of 15 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Paresthesias
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter placement, an expected average of 15 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Intravascular cannulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter placement, an expected average of 15 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Intrathecal placement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter placement, an expected average of 15 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Difficult catheter removal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter removal, an expected average of 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Catheter breakage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter removal, an expected average of 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Catheter wire uncoiling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The duration of epidural catheter removal, an expected average of 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal satisfaction with the overall quality of analgesia/anesthesia during labor and delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours following delivery

arm_group.description: Multiport flexible catheter has three ports for the delivery of epidural medication for labor analgesia
Uniport flexible catheter has one port for the delivery of epidural medication for labor analgesia

intervention.description: Multiport flexible catheter has three ports for the delivery of epidural medication
Uniport flexible catheter has one port for the delivery of epidural medication

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists Classification I-III parturients
- Mixed parity
- Estimated gestational age of at least 37 weeks
- Singleton gestation
- Cephalic presentation
- Spontaneous or induced labor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) > 45 kg/m2
- Prior cesarean section
- Multiple gestation
- Fetal abnormality
- Use of chronic analgesic medication
- Local anesthetic allergy
- Coagulopathy or anticoagulation
- Infection at epidural insertion site
- Spinal deformity other than mild scoliosis
- Uncontrolled/uncompensated/uncorrected cerebral, cardiovascular, pulmonary, gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, endocrinologic, metabolic, or hematologic condition
